item.title: Pirouette: higher-order typed functional choreographies
item.description: [!ABSTRACT] Abstract We present Pirouette, a language for typed higher-order functional choreographic programming. Pirouette offers programmers the ability to write a centralized functional program and compile it via endpoint projection into programs for each node in a distributed system.

item.title: Metastable failures in distributed systems
item.description: [!ABSTRACT] Abstract We describe metastable failures—a failure pattern in distributed systems. Currently, metastable failures manifest themselves as black swan events; they are outliers because nothing in the past points to their possibility, have a severe impact, and are much easier to explain in hindsight than to predict.

item.title: Generating Knitting Patterns from a Sketch: a CSP Approach
item.description: [!ABSTRACT] Abstract Graphic patterns in knitting are composed of relatively large pixels and create a picture when seen from a distance, while on close viewing the image falls apart into its constituent stitches.
